you should not be able to use root in ubuntu, it's a locked account
use a normal user as you are supposed to, if you are using root you should know how to set it up and the differences it will create in the enviornment
then make the user a sudoer
add the user to the admin group
add the user to the admin group
uncalled for too
no
how are you launching it
as the new user do "sudo apt-get update" - what happens

there you go
the user needs to be in the admin group

either
Linux "censor" 2.6.18-238.9.1.el5.028stab089.1 #1 SMP Thu Apr 14 14:06:01 MSD 2011 i686 GNU/Linux
that is a custom version of ubuntu based on a redhat kernel
i am on ubuntu 10 04 lucid
that means the standard ubuntu setup is not valid, I suggest you contact the people who support this platform for support
it's not ubuntu - it's a custom version of ubuntu, the people who built/support this are the people who need to support you
